USAID Nigeria Office of HIV/AIDS and Tuberculosis is establishing the Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning Activity. The Activity will support the Office’s efforts and also PEPFAR Nigeria at large to inform focused implementation strategies and approaches that effectively control and curve the HIV epidemic by contributing to 1.Utilization of data to address critical questions for the control of the HIV and tuberculosis epidemics; 2.Improved documentation, translation and dissemination of program learning across the clinical cascade of prevention, early detection, diagnostic, treatment and quality of life improvement services; 3. Improved governance and a strengthened national health system that assures appropriate policies, resource allocations and implementation of HIV/AIDS and tuberculosis services. The Activity will provide relevant support to HIV-TB by applying systematic monitoring and evaluation approaches to track and report program performance data for USAID Nigeria supported PEPFAR sites. Systematic monitoring will include tracking indicator data routinely collected by Implementing Partners including monitoring, evaluation and reporting (MER) indicators, SIMS quality metrics, demographic and epidemiological. Data will be tracked and monitored for use with internal and external reporting to the GON, OGAC, USAID/Washington and other donors and stakeholders. The contractor will complete data collection by deploying the Site Improvement Monitoring System (SIMS), data base management (DHIS2/DATIM) and data exchange from USG DHIS2 to the PEPFAR data reporting system (DATIM). In addition, the project will track and provide programmatic recommendations to better use demographic and epidemiological data, conduct requisite assessments, and support implementation.
